mar1ow2003 wrote:
> I need to perform a somewhat unusual crawl in which I have many seeds
> (100's of thousands) all from the same host, and only want to extract
> pages under a couple directories from that host.  However, I want to
> be able to crawl all the pages discovered from a seed before moving on
> to the next seed.  How can I make those discovered pages move up the
> queue in front of the seeds?

In general 'embeds' (things necessary to render a page) are 
fetched ASAP after their containing page, before other 
already-waiting pages. But, this would not include other linked 
pages, which go to the back of the queue.

I can't think of a way to achieve exactly what you want with 
standard Heritrix options/settings. I think it would take some 
hacking at the code.

(A possible approach would be to give all discovered URIs the same 
'scheduling directive' that currently only embeds get. Embeds get 
their escalation in AbstractFrontier.applySpecialHandling(); a 
similar esclation is done in LinksScoper.handlePrerequisite(), and 
LinksScoper might be the best place to do blanket 
scheduled-in-front directives.)

Separately, Heritrix does not yet handle very large seed lists 
gracefully -- over a certain size, you can't enter (or view) them 
through the web UI. But, you can still launch jobs with 
multi-hundred-thousand seed lists via the command line.
